TextBlock.Text: <color=lightblue>Enji</color>: An update on the current situation. I... just lost a warp core.

I'm in the process of sealing off Locomocean's refinery and I brought one of the white hole cores by leaping to the planet. I hit a patch of land. On an ocean planet. Not quite the splash I was hoping to make (Ha ha. I'm in pain).

Now, I didn't break anything... I think. But I lost grip of the <color=orange>core</color> and I'm not about to go back to swimming with the fishies to find it, nor can I spare the time to. I'll grab another to use instead.

If I had to guess where it was? Based on the ocean current, probably the <color=orange>South Pole</color>. But I'm not about to go digging in the sand because <color=lightblue>A)</color> I hate sand, <color=lightblue>B)</color> I hate the fish, and <color=lightblue>C)</color> I don't have time for that.
I'm fortunate enough that I didn't end up losing the <color=orange>black hole</color> warp core instead. What a pain that would be!
<color=orange>Update</color>: It would seem that The Universe has it out for me. Me and my big mouth.
Wait, I'm not talking, I'm writing. Me and my... big hands? No, that sounds dumb.
